biography: Tim Bowness is a british singer/songwriter primarily known for his work as part of the band No-Man, a long-term project with Steven Wilson from Porcupine Tree.  In addition to producing several albums with No-Man, Tim has recorded with popular Italian artist Alice, experimental guitar legend David Torn, Soft Machine's Hugh Hopper, Roger Eno, German band Centrozoon, and recorded the album Flame (1994) in collaboration with Porcupine Tree/ex-Japan keyboard player Richard Barbieri.  Tim's debut solo album, My Hotel Year, was released on the One Little Indian label in 2004.
name: Tim Bowness

discogs.name: Tim Bowness
discogs.profile: Primarily known for his work as a part of the band No-Man, a long-term project co-founded with Porcupine Tree's Steven Wilson, Tim Bowness has additionally performed with a highly eclectic range of musicians both as guest artist and collaborator.

theaudiodb.biography_en: Tim Bowness is a british singer/songwriter primarily known for his work as part of the band No-Man, a long-term project with Steven Wilson from Porcupine Tree.  In addition to producing several albums with No-Man, Tim has recorded with popular Italian artist Alice, experimental guitar legend David Torn, Soft Machine's Hugh Hopper, Roger Eno, German band Centrozoon, and recorded the album Flame (1994) in collaboration with Porcupine Tree/ex-Japan keyboard player Richard Barbieri.  Tim's debut solo album, My Hotel Year, was released on the One Little Indian label in 2004.

In addition to producing several albums with No-Man, Tim has recorded with popular Italian artist Alice, experimental guitar legend David Torn, Soft Machine's Hugh Hopper, Roger Eno, German band Centrozoon, and recorded the album Flame (1994) in collaboration with Porcupine Tree/ex-Japan keyboard player Richard Barbieri.
